newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures end lower across the board.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures end lower across the board.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended lower on Friday, reflecting the yen's firmer tone against the dollar and weaker rubber prices in producing countries, traders said.
Prices ranged from 1.2 to 3.7 yen per kg lower, with benchmark December ending down 2.6 yen at 109.7 yen per kg.

All contracts fell from the opening as local investors sold actively, traders said. The floating of the Thai baht is likely to depress rubber prices for a while, they said. "We expect long-liquidation by local investors to cap the topside until the spot month's expiry on July 25," a trader said.
